parameters.name: q
parameters.description: An issue query expression, must be used together with the 'qm' parameter

parameters.name: qm
parameters.description: Syntax mode for the 'q' parameter, mandatory if the 'q' parameter is used

parameters.name: showhidden
parameters.description: If 'true', include hidden issues in search results. If 'false', exclude hidden issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showremoved
parameters.description: If 'true', include removed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude removed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showsuppressed
parameters.description: If 'true', include suppressed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude suppressed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showshortfilenames
parameters.description: If 'true', only short file names will be displayed in issues list.

parameters.name: groupaxistype
parameters.description: List of allowed patterns: APP_NAME, SCAN_DATE, SCAN_PRODUCT, ISSUE_FOLDER, ISSUE_CATEGORY, ISSUE_KINGDOM, ISSUE_FILENAME, ISSUE_FRIORITY, ISSUE_AUDITED, ISSUE_PACKAGE_NAME, ISSUE_CLASS_NAME, ISSUE_FUNCTION_NAME, ISSUE_MAPPED_CATEGORY, FOLDER_FOLDER, ISSUE_{name of issue attribute}, EXTERNALLIST_{external category name}, CUSTOMTAG_{custom tag name}.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: A start offset in object listing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A maximum number of returned objects in listing, if '-1' or '0' no limit is applied

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: An issue query expression, must be used together with the 'qm' parameter

parameters.name: qm
parameters.description: Syntax mode for the 'q' parameter, mandatory if the 'q' parameter is used

parameters.name: showhidden
parameters.description: If 'true', include hidden issues in search results. If 'false', exclude hidden issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showremoved
parameters.description: If 'true', include removed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude removed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showsuppressed
parameters.description: If 'true', include suppressed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude suppressed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showshortfilenames
parameters.description: If 'true', only short file names will be displayed in issues list.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated value list of issue ids. If provided, other filtering and ordering parameters can not be used.

parameters.description: A maximum number of returned objects in listing, if '-1' or '0' no limit is applied

parameters.name: showhidden
parameters.description: If 'true', include hidden issues in search results. If 'false', exclude hidden issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showremoved
parameters.description: If 'true', include removed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude removed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: showsuppressed
parameters.description: If 'true', include suppressed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude suppressed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: A start offset in object listing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A maximum number of returned objects in listing, if '-1' or '0' no limit is applied

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: A start offset in object listing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A maximum number of returned objects in listing, if '-1' or '0' no limit is applied

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The url-encoded value of a source file query expression "path:<path_to_file_in_quotes>+AND+scan_id:<s_id>". For example, "q=path:%22JavaSource%2Forg%2Fowasp%2Fwebgoat%2Flessons%2FCSRF.java%22%2Band%2Bscan_id:1". If 'scan_id' is not provided, the search defaults to the latest scan of the application version.

parameters.description: A search-spec of full text search query (see fulltextsearch parameter)

parameters.name: fulltextsearch
parameters.description: If 'true', interpret 'q' parameter as full text search query, defaults to 'false'

parameters.description: Specify value 'true' to revoke all authentication tokens of current logged-in user. This parameter can only be used if the 'ids' parameter is not being used.

Retrieve the current user's session preferences. (The 'username' parameter is not yet supported)

post.summary: Resend a history item using current webhook's configuration.

Alert History Entry.description: Alert history entry contains information about firede alert, like trigger date, user name for which alert was triggered, information abotu alert definition.

customMessage.description: Required field for Scheduled alerts, Optional for other types

AlertDefinitionDto.description:
Alert definitions can include variable or performance indicator to determine when Software Security Center is
to generate an alert notification in the Todo List on the Dashboard.

alertHistoryIds.description: Alert history ids to set status

status.description: Status of alerts, classified as read or unread

AlertSetStatusRequest.description: Request to set status for alerts

autoConfigurationMode.description: Indicates whether SSC application is in auto configuration mode

configVisitRequired.description: Indicates whether a config visit is needed

maintenanceMode.description: Indicates whether SSC application is in maintenance mode

restartRequired.description: Indicates whether a restart is needed

ApplicationNameTestRequest.description: Request to test whether application with provided name exists

ApplicationNameTestResponse.description: Response of testing whether application exists

Artifact.description: Application version artifact that contains scan results.

artifactIds.description: List containing single artifact ID to approve
List containing single artifact ID to purge

hasAccess.description: whether the assigned user currently has access to the application version in current context

attributeDefinitionId.description: ID required when referencing an existing Attribute Definition.

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing Attribute.

value.description: Attribute value - should be set if Attribute Definition type is NUMBER/STRING/BOOLEAN/DATE/FILE

values.description: Attribute Options associated with Attribute Definition with type=SINGLE/MULTIPLE

guid.description: Unique string identifier for this Attribute Definition

hasDefault.description: Set to true if this Attribute Definition should be the default

hidden.description: Set to true if this Attribute Definition is hidden

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing Attribute Definition

inUse.description: True when Attribute Definition is associated with one or more application versions

isDeletable.description: True if this Attribute Definition can be deleted with force parameter

options.description: List of options (i.e. values) associated with this Attribute Definition

required.description: Set to true if this Attribute Definition is required

guid.description: Unique string identifier for an Attribute Option

hidden.description: Set to true if this option is to be hidden

id.description: ID required with referencing an existing Attribute Option

inUse.description: Set to true if this option is being used

index.description: Index of this option in list of options

projectMetaDataDefId.description: ID of Attribute Definition this option is associated with

tokens.description: A list of tokens (atleast one) to revoke

AuthTokenRevokeRequest.description: Request for revoking tokens by value

codeVerifier.description: Code Verifier, high-entropy cryptographic random string matching regular expression ^[a-zA-Z0-9.~_-]{43,128}$

Authentication Code Exchange Request.description: Request exchange of authentication code and code verifier for a token

description.description: Purpose for which the token will be requested.

terminalDate.description: Date and time the token expires (in ISO 8601 format). If not specified, it will default to the maximum lifetime for this token type.

Authentication Code Generate Request.description: Request a new authentication code for token specification

displayName.description: Display Name supports the use of wildcard matching. So, for example, "L*" will match Lando Calrissian and Lara Croft.

ldapDn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) that is only set for LDAP user accounts

Authentication Entity.description: A user account that can be used to authenticate in SSC. There are currently three types of user accounts that fall into this category: SSC local users, local users managed by external service, and LDAP users registered with SSC.

creationDate.description: Date and time the token was created (in ISO 8601 format)

description.description: Purpose for which the token was requested.

remainingUsages.description: The remaining number of api calls that can be made using this token. A value of -1 denotes unlimited number of calls.

terminalDate.description: Date and time the token expires (in ISO 8601 format). If not specified, it will default to the maximum lifetime for this token type.

token.description: String that represents the authentication token. (For security reasons, this value is null except for a successful token creation response.)

required.description: Set to true if configuration is required

bugFilingRequirements.description: Modified values of bug filing requirements. Not setting this attribute means that initial set of bug filing requirements need to be returned

changedParamIdentifier.description: Changed bug filing requirements parameter identifier. Value is required if bugFilingRequirements attribute is provided and ignored if bugFilingRequirements is not set

password.description: Bug tracker password. If not set, bug filing requirements LOGIN action must be called before sending this reques

username.description: Bug tracker username. If not set, bug filing requirements LOGIN action must be called before sending this reques

BugFilingRequirementsRequest.description: Request initial or updated set of big filing requirements

BugFilingRequirementsResponse.description: Response of validating connection credentials and returns bug filing requirements

testPlugin.description: Bugtracker plugin information to test connection

BugTrackerRequest.description: Request to test bugtracker plugin connection

bugTrackerPluginId.description: Identifier of the bug tracker plugin associated with this template group.

deletable.description: Flag that says if bugfield template group can be deleted.

id.description: unique identifier of bugfield template group.

name.description: short name of associated bug tracker plugin. (May be null if plugin is not currently enabled.)

objectVersion.description: version of bugfield template group stored on the server. This value is used for optimistic locking to prevent concurrent modification by different users at the same time.

valueList.description: Collection of all templates belonging to this bugfield template group.

requests.description: A list of bulk request items that represents requests that could have been issued independently (or use HATEOAS "response" scheme requests that map to individual requests).

clientName.description: Client name for which to retrieve the session ID

clientSessionId.description: Opaque unique identifier for the current user session (between 43 and 255 characters)

jobTokens.description: List containing single ScanCentral token to cancel

CloudPoolMapping.description: Application version to ScanCentral pool mapping

CloudPoolProjectVersionActionResponse.description: Result of cloud pool actions relating to application versions

projectVersionIds.description: List of application version ids to assign to cloud pool

CloudPoolProjectVersionAssignRequest.description: Request to assign application versions to the cloud pool

projectVersionIds.description: List of application version ids to replace in cloud pool

CloudPoolProjectVersionReplaceRequest.description: Request to replace application versions in the cloud pool

CloudPoolWorkerActionResponse.description: Result of ScanCentral workers related actions

workerUuids.description: List of worker UUIds to assign to the cloud pool

CloudPoolWorkerAssignRequest.description: Request to assign cloud workers to cloud pool

workerUuids.description: List of worker UUIds to disable from the cloud pool

CloudPoolWorkerDisableRequest.description: Request to disable workers from the cloud pool

workerUuids.description: List of worker UUIds to replace in the cloud pool

CloudPoolWorkerReplaceRequest.description: Request to replace workers in the cloud pool

controllerDiskFree.description: Free disk space in controller's job directory [bytes]

controllerDiskUsed.description: Disk space used by files in controller's job directory [bytes]

properties.description: Collection of configuration properties defined in the system

ConfigProperties.description: Collection of SSC application configuration properties

appliedAfterRestarting.description: Should the SSC server be restarted after changing value of the property to apply the changes.

configPropertyValueValidation.description: Meta information about how the property's value should be validated on the client side.

group.description: Parent group name the property belongs to.

groupSwitchEnabled.description: Flag is set to TRUE if property is allowed to be edited on UI.

protectedOption.description: If special permission is required to get value of this property.

required.description: Flag is set to TRUE if this property is required and always must have non empty value.

subGroup.description: Parent subgroup name the property belongs to.

value.description: Configuration property value. Depends on property type. It can be number, string, URL, email or value from values list.

valuesList.description: List of allowed property values if property type is OPTIONLIST or DYNAMIC_OPTIONLIST.

version.description: Configuration property version stored on the server. This value is used for optimistic locking of the property object to prevent concurrent changes of the property value by different users at the same time.

displayName.description: Value display name. This string is displayed on UI in the option values list.

value.description: Value that is sent to server if this option is selected on UI.

ConfigPropertyValueItem.description: Allowed values of the property which type is OPTIONLIST or DYNAMIC_OPTIONLIST.

ConfigPropertyValueValidation.description: SSC configuration property value validation type

singleLogoutSupported.description: Information if current authentication type support single logout

autoApplied.description: Flag equals true if custom tag values was applied automatically

newCustomTagIndex.description: index of assigned tag value within the list of values for that custom tag

Custom Tag.description: A custom tag value being assigned to issues in the application

defaultValue.description: Default value of the custom tag. Actual string value is presented here.

defaultValueIndex.description: Index of default value of the custom tag. This is ordinal number of the item in CustomTagLookup collection.

deletable.description: Flag that says if custom tag can be deleted. Custom tag which values are currently in use cannot be deleted.

extensible.description: Flag that says if custom tag is extensible or not.

hidden.description: Is custom tag hidden or not.

inUse.description: Is custom tag values are selected for any issues in the system.

objectVersion.description: Custom tag version stored on the server. This value is used for optimistic locking of the custom tag object to prevent concurrent modification of the custom tag by different users at the same time.

primaryTag.description: If this custom tag is set as primary tag for a specific application version. This value is initialized only if custom tags for specific application version are requested.

restriction.description: Flag is set to true if special permission is required to set values of this custom tag.

restrictionType.description: Special permission type if restriction is set to TRUE.

valueList.description: Collection of all possible custom tag values.

consideredIssue.description: Flag that should be used to mark values that mean "not an issue" or "false positive".

customTagGuid.description: GUID of the parent custom tag this value belongs to.

defaultValue.description: Flag that says if this value is default custom tag value and should be selected automatically in the values list on issue audit screen.

deletable.description: Flag that says if this value can be removed from custom tag. Value cannot be removed if it is selected for some issue in the system.

hidden.description: Flag that says that this value is hidden and cannot be selected in issue audit mode.

lookupIndex.description: Current value index in values list.

relyingCustomTags.description: List of relying custom tags and their values this value depends on. This list should be set to automatically reflect relying custom tags values changes to this custom tag value

appVersionId.description: Application version id - required if DatasetName = "Audit"

datasetName.description: Dataset name - e.g. "Audit", "Issue Stats" - corresponds to page from which data is exported

documentInfoId.description: Document Info id for file blob

expiration.description: Data export file expiration in days

note.description: Note, i.e. comments or info related to data being exported

userName.description: User name of user who initiated the data export

dynamicScanRequestIds.description: List containing a single dynamic scan request id to cancel

DynamicScanCancelRequest.description: Request for cancelling a dynamic scan request

id.description: Unique identifier of dynamic scan request

lastUpdateDate.description: The date that the dynamic scan request was updated

objectVersion.description: The object version of the dynamic scan request

parameters.description: Parameters that are needed for dynamic scan request

requestedDate.description: The date that the dynamic scan request was submitted

status.description: The status of the dynamic scan request

submitter.description: The id of the user who submitted the dynamic scan request

fileValueDocumentInfoId.description: The file value document info id for an upload file

fileValueName.description: The name of an uploaded file

objectVersion.description: The objecct version of this parameter

valueOptions.description: The name of the uploaded file

values.description: A list of possible values for this parameter

DynamicScanRequestParameter.description: Dynamic Scan Request Parameter DTO object

guid.description: Unique string identifier for this parameter definition

id.description: Unique id for this parameter definition

type.description: Attribute Definition Type from which this parameter definition is based on

guid.description: Unique string identifier for a Dynamic Scan Request Parameter Option

id.description: Unique ID for this parameter option

index.description: Index of this option in list of options

DynamicScanRequestParameterOption.description: Dynamic Scan Request Parameter Option DTO object

parameters.description: Parameters that are needed for dynamic scan request

canEditOrCancel.description: Flag that indicates whether the user may edit or cancel the dynamic scan request

canSubmit.description: Flag that indicates whether the user can submit dynamic scan requests

dynamicScanDisabled.description: Flag that indicates whether dynamic scan request is disabled

dynamicScanDisabledMessage.description: A message indicating the reason for why dynamic scan is disabled

lastScanId.description: The id of the last dynamic scan request

lastScanSummary.description: Holds information about the last dynamic scan request

Engine type.description: Types of the analyzers (engines) that produces issues

EntityStateIdentifier.description: Simple API entity that contains only ID and revision.

collapseIssues.description: Will collapse issues in exported files

projectVersionId.description: Application version id to export audit data

ExportAuditToCSVRequest.description: Request to export audit information to CSV file

ExportIssueStatsToCSVRequest.description: Request to export issue stats to CSV file

projectVersionId.description: Application version id to export open source component data

ExportOscToCsvRequest.description: Request to export open source component information to CSV file

externalBugDeepLink.description: Link to a bug the user can navigate to by clicking the link

fileBugForSelectAll.description: True if user wants to file a bug for all selected issues in UI

issueCount.description: Count of issues for which a bug is filed

Feature.description: A feature that is available on the server instance

token.description: Value of single-use token to be used as the 'mat' URL parameter during a file operation

File token.description: Token to upload or download files

defaultFilterSet.description: whether this filter set is the default within its issue template

folders.description: List of folders defined in filter set

Filter Set.description: basic info on a filter set (does not include filters)

color.description: Color that should be used to represent folder on UI

guid.description: Folder GUID. Guid is unique across all the folders defined for a application version

orderIndex.description: Numeric value used for ordering folder from the most important to the least important

projectVersionId.description: ID of the application version for which folder is defined

color.description: Folder color. Folder will be marked by this color on UI

FolderDto.description: Issues folder. This is a readonly object, it cannot be created using SSC API.

invokingUserName.description: SSC username which initiated the job

Fortify job.description: Fortify job DTO object, carries less information than the main Job DTO. Used primarily for the snapshot refresh which be initiated by a non-admin user

issueCountAllProjectVer.description: total number of issues assigned to user across all application versions

issueCountCertainProjectVer.description: number of issues assigned to user in current application version

Issue Assignment.description: counts of issues assigned to user

Issue Attachment.description: attachment (such as screenshot) associated with issue

Issue Audit Comment.description: An audit comment associated with an issue

Issue Primary Tag.description: Store the information about issue primary custom tag

hiddenCount.description: Total number of hidden issues in the application version

hiddenDisplayableCount.description: Number of displayable hidden issues in the application version

removedDisplayableCount.description: Number of displayable removed issues  in the application version

suppressedCount.description: Total number of suppressed issues in the application version

suppressedDisplayableCount.description: Number of displayable suppressed issues in the application version

Issue Summary.description: Used to chart variable and performance indicators of application version's issues.

averageDaysToRemediate.description: Average number of days to fix issues in application versions.

averageDaysToReview.description: Average number of days to review issues in application versions.

bugDensity.description: Bug density per 10 000 of scanned lines of code.

filesScanned.description: Number of files that were scanned in all application versions.

id.description: This is dynamic attribute which value depend of the aggregation attribute. It can be application ID, application version ID or application version attribute GUID.

issuesPendingReview.description: Number of issues that are pending review in all application versions.

linesOfCode.description: Number of lines of code that were scanned by scans which results are stored in the application versions.

name.description: This is dynamic attribute which value depend of the aggregation attribute. It can be application name, application version name or application version attribute name.

numberOfApplicationVersions.description: Number of application versions in the application.

oldestScanDate.description: Issue audites that have been done after this date have been taken into account for average days to review calculation.

openIssues.description: Number of not remediated issues in all application versions.

snapshotOutOfDate.description: Flag that indicates that application metrics state was changed and it metrics are going to be recalculated.

IssueAgingDto.description: Issue aging object contains application metrics.

id.description: ID of issue aging table grouping attribute. This ID should be passed to issue aging endpoint to return issue aging items that belongs only to this group

name.description: Name of the group to display it on UI.

IssueAgingGroupDto.description: Issue aging group object contains definition of application version attribute that can be used for issue aging table grouping.

IssueAgingPortlet.description: Issue aging portlet object contains application and issue metrics.

IssueAssignUserRequest.description: Request to assign user to the issues

auditDateTime.description: Date and time when audit was performed.

conflict.description: Flag that indicates if there were any conflicts when audit information was merged.

issueId.description: ID of the issue the history record belongs to

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence number of the history record in the list of all audit history records for the issue.

userName.description: Name of the user who performed the audit.

customTagAudit.description: Custom tag values that are set for the issue.

customTagValues.description: Custom tag values that are set for the issue.

projectVersionId.description: ID of the application version the audited issue belongs to.

userName.description: User assigned to the audited issue.

IssueAuditResult.description: Issue audit result contains the most rescent issue audit information after performing issue audit.

bugParams.description: Bug parameters to file the bug

filterBy.description: Filter by property contains a valid issue search expression if bug needs to be filed for a set of issues identified by this search expression. If empty, bug will be filed for all issues exist in application version. Value is ignored if filterSet value is not set.

filterSet.description: Application version filter set id. Parameter must be set only if filterBy property is set that indicates that issues search expression must be used to identify issues to be filed as bugs. If issues are identified by IDs (issueInstanceIds parameter is set), filterSet must not be set

issueInstanceIds.description: Instance id of issues that need to be filed as bugs. Ignored if filterSet attribute is set that indicates that issues search expression must be used to identify issues to be filed as bugs

password.description: Bug tracker password. If not set, bug filing requirements LOGIN action must be called before sending this reques

username.description: Bug tracker username. If not set, bug filing requirements LOGIN action must be called before sending this reques

IssueFileBugRequest.description: Request to file the bug from the issues

entityType.description: Type of the issue attriute that can be used for ordering or filtering.

filterSelectorType.description: If value of the selector can be chose from the list of predefined values, or if it can contain any value defined by user.

value.description: Selector set's value that must be sent to backend when this option is selected.

IssueFilterSelector.description: DTO object that holds the information about specific issue attribute that can be used for filtering issues list.

filterBySet.description: List of all possible issues filterring attributes.

groupBySet.description: List of all possible issues grouping attributes.

IssueFilterSelectorSet.description: Composite object that holds information about issue attributes that can be used for issue list filtering and grouping.

customTagAudit.description: Custom tag values that are set for the issue.

IssueUpdateTagRequest.description: Request to update custom tag for the issues

dataVersion.description: Issue data version for which template is created.

engineType.description: Engine type for which template is created.

id.description: Unique identifier of the issue view template.

metadataId.description: Id of the plugin meta data for which template is created.

artifactName.description: Artifact name related to this job

cancellable.description: Set to true if job is cancelable

projectName.description: Application name related to this job

projectVersionId.description: Application version identifier related to this job

projectVersionName.description: Application version name related to this job

userName.description: Name of user this job was created by

jobIds.description: List containing single jobName value to cancel

warningList.description: Detailed information about job priority change.

count.description: Number of the warnings of for the specific job class.

roles.description: List of roles pertaining to this LDAP entity

userPhoto.description: Photo object if LDAP entity is user

LDAP entity.description: An LDAP entity like user, group or organization

baseDn.description: Distinguished name (DN) of root (base) LDAP entity SSC has access to. If value is set to not empty entity's DN, SSC has access only to this entity and all its children. If value of this attribute is an empty string, SSC has access to whole LDAP entities tree

defaultServer.description: Boolean flag that marks LDAP server as default. Default means the server which configuration was imported from ldap.properties legacy configuration file

enableUserStatusMapping.description: Enable mapping of user status flags (e.g. disabled/locked) based on attributes of ldap user entries. Cannot be enabled if ldapServerType is 'OTHER'.

enabled.description: Flag that marks server as enabled. All enabled servers are used by SSC. Server can be temporary disabled if it is temporary down.

ldapServerType.description: Specify the type of LDAP server implementation (if known). It can be useful for certain operations (e.g. for setting user status flags)

objectVersion.description: Version of the LDAP server entity to support editing LDAP server entity by multiply administrators

serverName.description: Name of the LDAP server to distinguish it from other servers

expirationDate.description: Date when license is going to be expired

externallyManaged.description: If Local Group is managed by an external service

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing Local Group

name.description: Local Group's name. Note: value is readonly for externally managed groups.

objectVersion.description: Local Group version stored on the server. This value is used to prevent concurrent updates.

roles.description: List of Roles assigned to a Local Group

Local Group.description: Local Group DTO object. Note: For externally managed groups, all fields except for roles are readonly.

externallyManaged.description: If user is managed by an external service

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing Local User

objectVersion.description: LocalUser version stored on the server. This value is used to prevent concurrent updates of LocalUsers.

passwordNeverExpire.description: True if user's password never expires

requirePasswordChange.description: Is user required to change password on first login?

roles.description: List of Roles assigned to user

suspended.description: True if user's account is locked

Local User.description: Local User DTO object. Note: For externally managed users, all fields except for roles are readonly.

defaultPolicy.description: True if this obsolete policy is also configured as system default policy

obsoleteAvCount.description: Count of application versions where this obsolete policy has been found

policyName.description: Obsolete prediction policy name found in application version

category.description: Category - The category for this issue.

controllable.description: Does the application send user input to the vulnerable open source code?

cve.description: CVE ID in the format CVE-xxxxx-xxxx

cveUrl.description: CVE URL - URL to get more information about this CVE.

cwe.description: CWE ID in the format CWE-xxxx

cweUrl.description: CWE URL - URL to get more information about the related CWE

filename.description: Filename of the component where the CVE exists

invoked.description: Does the application call the vulnerable open source code?

version.description: Component version containing the CVE vulnerability

extraDictionary.description: Get additional words to add to dictionary. If null, current user data will be added (for example: username, first name, last name, email).

password.description: Get password or its part from input

PasswordStrengthCheckResponse.description: Result of checking strength of password

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing Performance Indicator History object

value.description: Required if referencing an existing Performance Indicator History  object

PerformanceIndicator.description:
Performance indicators enable you to combine variables into metrics that are
normalized across application version boundaries

dependsOnPermission.description: Set of permissions this permission requires

permittedActions.description: Actions this permission is allowed to perform

apiVersion.description: Version string of the SSC plugin api used to develop the plugin

dataVersion.description: An integer used to tag the set of issue attributes provided by this plugin.

engineType.description: Name of the scan engine supported by the plugin. Value is defined for parser plugins only

lastUsedOfKind.description: Tracks whether this plugin instance was the most recently used of its kind

pluginConfiguration.description: Additional configuration properties used by the plugin

pluginId.description: Identifier of the plugin, usually a fully-qualified classname. Non-unique when multiple versions of same plugin exist

pluginName.description: A string name for the plugin

pluginType.description: Denotes functionality of the plugin instance, such as scan parsing, bugtracker integration.

pluginVersion.description: A version string of the implementation code of the plugin

supportedEngineVersions.description: Versions of the scan engine results supported by the plugin. Value is defined for parser plugins only

systemInstalled.description: whether the plugin instance was installed by adding the jar to a special system folder

vendorName.description: Name of the company / organization that developed the plugin

Plugin Meta Data.description: plugin meta data holds attributes of the plugins installed in the application.

PluginConfiguration.description: additional configuration needed for a plugin.

pluginIds.description: List containing single plugin ID to disable
List containing single plugin ID to enable

Policy replacement.description: Audit Assistant prediction policy replacement mapping

issueTemplateId.description: Id of the Issue Template used

active.description: True if this version is active

autoPredict.description: true if auto-prediction is enabled for this application version; false otherwise. This property modification is protected by AUDITASSISTANT_MANAGE permission.

bugTrackerEnabled.description: true if the bug tracker plugin assigned to the application version is currently enabled in the system

bugTrackerPluginId.description: identifier of the bug tracker plugin (if any) assigned to this application version

committed.description: True if this version is committed and ready to be used

customTagValuesAutoApply.description: true if custom tag values auto-apply is enabled for this application version; false otherwise. This property modification is protected by AUDITASSISTANT_MANAGE permission.

issueTemplateId.description: Id of the Issue Template used by this version

issueTemplateModifiedTime.description: Last time the Issue Template was modified

issueTemplateName.description: Name of the Issue Template used by this version

latestScanId.description: id of the latest scan uploaded to application version

masterAttrGuid.description: Guid of the primary custom tag for this version

predictionPolicy.description: Name of the policy to be used for predictions for this application version. Modification of this property is protected by AUDITASSISTANT_MANAGE permission.

serverVersion.description: Server version this version's data supports

snapshotOutOfDate.description: True if the most recent snapshot is not accurate

staleIssueTemplate.description: True if this version's Issue Template has changed or been modified

Project Version.description: A version of an application on the server

committed.description: False if application version is in an incomplete state

assignedBugtrackerShortNameIfKnown.description: the short display name of the bug tracker. (will be null if no bugtracker is assigned or if there is no currently installed plugin matching the assigned pluginId.)

assignedPluginId.description: identifier of the bug tracker plugin assigned to the application version. (Bug tracker integration will be active only if the plugin is also enabled in the system.)

bugTracker.description: Bug tracker (note that this field will be null if the assigned bug tracker is not enabled in the SSC plugin framework.)

bugtrackerIsAssigned.description: indicates whether a bug tracker is assigned to the application version

Project version bug tracker.description: Object containing application version and bug tracker related data

audited.description: Flag is set for issues that has been audited and primary tag value was set for this issue.

externalBugId.description: Identifying information for the bug in the external bug tracking system. The actual format depends on the bug tracker plugin which filed the bug.

folderId.description: Deprecated - Issue folder identifier.  This may be incorrect or invalid.  Please use folderGuid instead.

fullFileName.description: Full file name where issue found

hasAttachments.description: Set to true if issue has attachments

hasComments.description: Set to true if issue has audit comments

hasCorrelatedIssues.description: Set to true if issue has other correlated issues

hidden.description: Set to true if issue is hidden

issueStatus.description: Flag represents issue review status and can have 3 types of values: Unreviewed, Under Review, Reviewed.

lastScanId.description: ID of the latest scan that found the issue

primaryTagValueAutoApplied.description: Flag equals true if value of custom tag was applied automatically

removed.description: Set to true if issue is suppressed

suppressed.description: Set to true if issue is suppressed

appSecTrainingUrl.description: A link to access application security training for this issue (available only if the SSC administrator has enabled it)

audited.description: Attribute is set to true if issue is audited (primary tag values is set for this issue)

className.description: Name of class where the vulnerability has been found

customAttributes.description: All the additional custom attributes defined for the issue by parser plugin

dataVersion.description: Version of the issue data. This attribute is initialized only for issues parsed by 3rd party parsers and is not set for the issues parsed by standard parsers included in SSC installation.

downloadRequest.description: Request contains binary or large data

downloadResponse.description: Response contains binary or large data"

fullFileName.description: Full file name where issue found

functionName.description: Name of function located in the file where the vulnerability has been found

hasViewTemplate.description: Flag that indicates if there is a view template that should be used to display issue details on UI.

hidden.description: Set to true if issue is hidden

issueState.description: Flag represents issue state and says if issue is not an issue or open issue. Rule to calculate value of thi flag is defined in issue template.

lastScanId.description: ID of the latest scan that found the issue

lineNumber.description: Line number in the file where the vulnerability has been found

mappedCategory.description: Name of the Fortify category of the vulnerability

minVirtualCallConfidence.description: Confidence level which estimates that vulnerability found in virtual (overridden) function will be executed by tainted source

packageName.description: Name of package where the vulnerability has been found

primaryTag.description: Identifier, name and value of the custom tag that is selected as a primary tag for the application version the issue belongs to.

remediationConstant.description: Level of complexity to fix this vulnerability

shortFileName.description: Short file name where issue found

sinkContext.description: Name of the context that contains vulnerability sink

source.description: Name of the a program point where tainted data enter the program

sourceContext.description: Name of the context that contains vulnerability sources

sourceFile.description: File name where vulnerability source is located.

sourceLine.description: Line number in the source file where vulnerability source is located

suppressed.description: Set to true if issue is suppressed

taintFlag.description: An attribute of tainted data that enables the data flow analyzer to discriminate between different types of taint

Project version issue details.description: Application version issue details DTO object

cleanName.description: Issue group name not containing count, dashes etc

Project version issue group.description: Application version issue group DTO object

projectVersionIds.description: List containing single application version ID to send audit assistant

ProjectVersionAuditByAssistantRequest.description: Request to send the application version's data to Audit Assistant for assessment

projectVersionIds.description: Application version ids to assign auth entity

ProjectVersionAuthEntityAssignRequest.description: Request to associate application versions to auth entity

externalBugIds.description: Identifying information for the bug links to be cleared. (The format of an externalBugId depends on the SSC bug tracker plugin which filed the bug)

ProjectVersionClearBugLinksRequest.description: Request to clear the specified bug links from the application version

ProjectVersionCopyCurrentStateRequest.description: Request to copy the current state from one application version to another

ProjectVersionCopyPartialRequest.description: Request to copy data selectively from one application version to another

projectVersionIds.description: List containing single application version ID to purge

purgeBefore.description: Purge all purgeable artifacts scanned before this date. If omitted, current date and time is used.

ProjectVersionPurgeRequest.description: Request to purge the artifacts in application versions

projectVersionIds.description: List containing single application version ID to refresh

ProjectVersionRefreshRequest.description: Request to refresh the application versions and trigger the historical snapshot job

ProjectVersionRefreshResponse.description: Response of refreshing application version and triggered history snapshot job

ProjectVersionTestRequest.description: Request to check whether a application version already exists in the system

found.description: Whether the application version was found

ProjectVersionTestResponse.description: Response of testing whether application version with name and exists in specified application

projectVersionIds.description: List containing single application version ID to send training for audit assistant

ProjectVersionTrainAuditAssistantRequest.description: Request to send the application version's data to Audit Assistant for training

currentPolicies.description: A list with current policy names from Audit Assistant server.

obsoletePolicies.description: A list of policy objects containing existing obsolete AV policy names as a result of comparison with current server policies.

policyReplacements.description: Mapping between old (obsolete) and new (existing) policy names; current AV policies and/or system default policy are to be replaced

properties.description: Audit Assistant server configuration properties to be used policies retrieval from Fortify Scan Analytics server

RefreshAuditAssistantPoliciesRequest.description: Audit Assistant server configuration (mandatory) and policy replacement mapping (optional)

Report Auth Entity.description: The Fortify User or Ldap User associated with a report

crossApp.description: True if report applies to multiple application versions

fileName.description: The name of the report definition file

inUse.description: Indicates whether the report definition is in use

renderingEngine.description: The engine used to render the report, e.g. BIRT

paramOrder.description: Order in which the parameter should appear

defaultValue.description: Indicates whether option is the default value

order.description: Order in which the parameter option should appear

Report project Version.description: The application version that is associated to a report

email.description: Email of user assigned to responsibility

firstName.description: First name of user assigned to responsibility

lastName.description: Last name of user assigned to responsibility

userId.description: ID of user assigned to responsibility

userName.description: Name of user assigned to responsibility

Responsibility Assignment.description: A Responsibility that a user in SSC is assigned to. There are currently a few responsibilities like Project Manager, Security Manager, Developer etc per Application.

Result processing rule.description: Rule to be checked when processing an FPR

allApplicationRole.description: True if a user with this Role has access to all Application Versions

assignedToNonUsers.description: True if this Role is currently assigned to entities that are not users(groups, organizations, etc.)

builtIn.description: True if this Role is a default Fortify Role

permissionIds.description: Ids of the permissions this Role has

Role.description: Role used by the server to determine user permissions

RulepackStatus.description: Object represents rulepack individual process status. This is readonly object.

RulepacksBatchProcessStatus.description: Object represents rulepack processing status. This is readonly object.

authEntity.description: The Fortify User or Ldap User associated with the report

formatDefaultText.description: Saved report output format default text

isPublished.description: Indicates whether saved report is published

artifactId.description: identifier of parent artifact object which contains this scan object

buildId.description: optional string identifier provided by the user when scanning

buildLabel.description: optional string identifier provided by the user when scanning

buildProject.description: optional string identifier provided by the user when scanning

buildVersion.description: optional string identifier provided by the user when scanning

certification.description: indicates whether the checksum on the analysis result is valid

execLOC.description: total executable lines of code included in sources (excluding comments etc.)

guid.description: globally unique id of scan object

noOfFiles.description: number of source files included in scan

totalLOC.description: total lines of code included in sources (includes comments etc.)

type.description: indicates the type of analyzer that produced it, such as SCA or WEBINSPECT

Scan.description: provides high-level information on the result of a single Fortify analysis, usually embedded inside an Artifact object

Scan Rulepack.description: A rulepack used in a scan

filter.description: The specified query string is matched against the name, firstName, lastName, and email fields for LDAP User entities. For Group and OrgUnit entities, only the name is matched. The query string must match the entire field value. For partial matches you can add asterisk ('*') wildcards to your query.

ldapType.description: Type of ldap objects to be matched

limit.description: A maximum number of returned objects in listing, if '-1' no limit is applied

start.description: A start offset in object listing

SearchLdapUnregisteredRequest.description: Request to search for unregistered ldap objects for potential assignment to SSC. The overall scope of searchable ldap objects is defined by the SSC ldap server configuration

value.description: Option's value that must be sent to backend when this option is selected.

SelectorOption.description: Single option of IssueFilterSelector. Every filtering option is associated with some specific issue attribute's value.

filePath.description: Full path to source file on the machine where scan was performed.

projectVersionId.description: Application version identifier that contains this source file.

SourceFileDto.description: Source file content where vulnerabilities were found.

System Configuration.description: System Configuration defined by key and values

capabilityDescription.description: Describes what tokens generated from this token specification can be used for. Note that these capabilities are subordinate to the actual roles/permissions granted to the owner of the token

maxDaysToLive.description: Maximum allowable lifetime (in nominal days) of token. At the time of token creation/edit, the exact value for its max expiration is calculated by adding maxDaysToLive * MilliSecondsPerDay to the current datetime

maxUsages.description: Maximum number of api calls that can be made using this token type. A value of -1 denotes unlimited number of calls.

Token Definition.description: Metadata of a Software Security Center token

childNodes.description: Child nodes of the current node.

file.description: Name of the file associated with this node.

fullPath.description: Full path to source file associated with this node.

line.description: Source file line number where issue was found.

Trigger.description: Trigger in a request or response that identifies a vulnerability

photoMimeType.description: Mime type of user photo. Eg .bmp, .jpg etc

emailAlerts.description: Receive email alerts if set to true

monitorAllRuntimeApps.description: Monitors all runtime applications if set to true

projectVersionListMode.description: Enum for ProjectVersionListMode with values DEFAULT, CUSTOM, ALL

receiveRuntimeAlerts.description: Receive runtime alerts if set to true

User preferences.description: Object containing user preferences such as date/time format

collabModuleEnabled.description: Set to true if collaboration module is enabled

displayUserDetails.description: Display user details if set to true

onDemandMode.description: Set to true if on demand mode is enabled

userType.description: User Type integer eg. 0 for Local

includeCommentsInHistory.description: If 'true', comments are included in issue audit history. Used only by flex UI.

projectVersionId.description: Application version ID the option values belong to. Value is empty for default options that can be applied to any application version user has access to if application version specific options are not defined.

showHidden.description: If 'true', include hidden issues in search results. If 'false', exclude hidden issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

showRemoved.description: If 'true', include removed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude removed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

showShortFileNames.description: If 'true', only short file names will be displayed in issues list.

showSuppressed.description: If 'true', include suppressed issues in search results. If 'false', exclude suppressed issues from search results. If no options are set, use application version profile settings to get value of this option.

UserIssueSearchOptions.description: User specific options that can be used for customizing issue search result.

UserSessionState.description: User session state is used to persist UI state

folderName.description: Select a folder from the default filter set to associate with the variable.

Variable.description: Variables count issues, conditions, and other categories of numeric data.

timestamp.description: The Date the variable value was taken

Variable History.description: An instance of a variable in an Application Version's snapshot.

wieRegistered.description: Set to true if WebInspect Enterprise is registered

allowInsecureTLS.description: Allow connection even if webhook destination server certificate cannot be verified. Both certificate trust and server name validation are suppressed. Applies only to HTTPS protocol.

contentType.description: The way how webhook will be delivered

creationDate.description: Date when this webhook was created

id.description: ID required when referencing an existing webhook definition

lastStatus.description: Status of this webhook's last completed request

monitorApps.description: If this webhook is set to monitor all application versions or a custom selection. If set to all application versions, it takes precedence over any custom selection application version ids.

monitorEvents.description: If this webhook is set to monitor all events or custom selection of events. If set to all events, it takes precedence over any custom selection of global/application events.

monitoredAppVersionEvents.description: Custom selection of application version based events to monitor by this webhook. No need to provide custom selection in case you choose to monitor all events.

monitoredAppVersionIds.description: Custom selection of application versions monitored by this webhook. No need to provide custom selection in case you choose to monitor all application versions.

monitoredGlobalEvents.description: Custom selection of global events (events that are not triggered by an action in specific application version) to monitor by this webhook. No need to provide custom selection in case you choose to monitor all events.

objectVersion.description: Webhook version stored on the server. This value is used for optimistic locking to prevent concurrent modification by different users at the same time.

restricted.description: True if current user is missing some permissions to fully manage this webhook

secretValue.description: Secret value will be used to sign webhook request. Requirements: min 8 and max 128 of printable ASCII characters (alphanumeric, punctuation, space).

useSscProxy.description: Enable using SSC proxy configuration if webhook receiver is behind a proxy.SSC proxy must be also enabled and configured.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the webhook request was created

failureReason.description: Reason of failure, if webhook request failed

requestHeaders.description: Request headers of webhook request. HTML-encoded.

requestPayload.description: Request payload of webhook request. HTML-encoded.

responseBody.description: Response body of webhook request. Truncated to 1500 characters and HTML-encoded.

responseHeaders.description: Response headers of webhook request. Truncated to 1000 characters and HTML-encoded.

restricted.description: True if current user is missing some permissions to fully view or resend this webhook request

webHookId.description: ID of webhook definition that triggered the webhook request

WebHook History.description: Information about triggered webhook requests including request and response data

createdAt.description: Date and time when the webhook request was created

webHookId.description: ID of webhook definition that triggered the webhook request

WebHook History Item.description: Basic information about triggered webhook request

webHookHistoryIds.description: List containing single webhook history ID to resend

WebHookResendRequest.description: Request to resend webhook payload from history

WorkersShutdownRequest.description: Request to shut down ScanCentral workers

customTagInfo.description: Holds the details about existed custom tag that is assigned or linked with some other entity

lookupIndex.description: Current value index in values list

customTagLookupInfo.description: Holds the details about existed list custom tag value that is assigned or linked with some other entity

scanId.description: id of scan associated with the error

scan error.description: error reported by SCA during the scan
